headline: Prediction: Disney Will Beat the Market. Here's Why
summary: In the past five years, investing in Walt Disney (NYSE: DIS) would've ended up costing you 12.5% of your starting capital.  Investors might not realize that Disney's Experiences segment is its most important, financially speaking.  Containing theme parks, cruise ships, and consumer products, this division accounted for 38% of the company's revenue in first-quarter 2025 (ended Dec. 28, 2024) and 61% of its operating income.

headline: Disney+'s solid content portfolio, including nearly 700 movies, is a key growth driver.
summary: Theme park business recovery, including new attractions like Frozen and Zootopia, is expected to boost Disney's prospects.
